column1: #Text=Víctor Manuel Báez Chino ( died 14 June 2012 ) was a Mexican crime journalist and editor for the digital edition of the Milenio newspaper in Xalapa and an editor for the crime-oriented website Reporteros Policiacos .
#Text=Báez was abducted 13 June 2012 and found murdered the next day in the main city square of Xalapa , Veracruz , Mexico . [ 2 ] [ 3 ] [ 4 ]

#Text=While he was the fifth journalist killed in the state of Veracruz in a two-month period in 2012 , he was the ninth journalists killed in Veracruz since March 2011 as a result of the Mexican Drug War . [ 1 ] [ 5 ] [ 6 ]
#Text=At the time of his murder , six journalists had been killed in Mexico in 2012 . [ 7 ]
#Text=Báez was the editor of the crime section for the state digital edition of the national newspaper Milenio and an editor of the website Reporteros Policiacos . [ 8 ]
#Text=He was a colleague of Regina Martínez Pérez , [ 9 ] a Proceso crime reporter who was also killed in 2012 . [ 10 ]
#Text=Báez 's corpse was found on a street named after Úrsulo Galván and near Parque Juárez ( pictured ) , Xalapa , which was close to his office . [ 5 ]
#Text=Mexico CityXalapaMentioned locations within Mexico relative to the capital Mexico City .
#Text=Víctor Manuel Báez was kidnapped by three armed men in a gray van outside of the offices of Reporteros Policiacos at around 11 p.m. when he was leaving work 13 June 2012 . [ 4 ]
#Text=Báez was found murdered the next day .
#Text=His body had been dumped on a street by Parque Juárez in the center of Xalapa , which is the capital of Veracruz state . [ 1 ] [ 2 ]
#Text=Los Zetas drug cartel took responsibility for his murder in a note was left by his body , which read , "
